RT @chrislhayes Slavery was wildly controversial, the Trail of Tears was extremely controversial, Korematsu was a 6-3 decision and the dissenters were completely correct. And on, and on. It‚Äôs easier to say ‚Äúthey didn‚Äôt know better‚Äù than ‚Äúthey chose evil.‚Äù

RT @chrislhayes Independent of current controversies, the one thing I think we do poorly in American history education is over-historicizing evils and atrocities. We learn ‚Äúthey didn‚Äôt know any better‚Äù but in every case there are contemporaries who did!

"I strongly urge my colleagues to take action now by supporting the NSF for the Future Act, and I reserve the balance of my time.
"With U.S. leadership in science and technology at risk, the U.S. must recommit to supporting basic research, cutting-edge facilities, and a thriving domestic STEM workforce.
"That‚Äôs due in large part to the Chairwoman‚Äôs leadership and our shared commitment to making sure America has the best research and development enterprise in the world.

"At every step in this process, Science Committee Republicans and Democrats have worked together to identify the challenges we face and craft the strongest possible legislation to support American competitiveness.

"H.R. 2225 is a strategic and sustainable approach to investing in American science and technology. I‚Äôd like to thank my colleague, Chairwoman Eddie Bernice Johnson, for all the work she has done with me to get this bill to the Floor today.
"Protections like these are all the more important as we increase investments in our research enterprise.
" Among the protections included in the bill is a provision that prohibits any grant recipients from participating in malign talent recruitment programs, like the Thousand Talents program.
"Importantly, the @NSF for the Future Act has a strong focus on protecting taxpayer-funded research from adversaries like China, Russia, and Iran.
"Our bill also expands the geographic diversity of American R&D, by building research capabilities at Minority Serving Institutions and universities outside of the top-100 research institutions.

"H.R. 2225 helps expand our #STEM workforce so that as we create the tech jobs of the future, we also develop US workers to fill them. It invests in STEM education at every level, from pre-k to post-doc programs, ensuring all Americans have access to high quality STEM resources.

"The NSF for the Future Act doubles funding for #basicresearch over 5 years, investing $78 bil. It also includes $13 bil. for a new Directorate for Science & Engineering Solutions focused on translating @NSF-funded discoveries into solutions to nat'l & societal challenges.
"The result is two bipartisan bills that significantly increase research funding while adding strong protections to keep it safe from foreign theft.

"While the Senate chose to tack on... special interest provisions, the @HouseScience @housesciencegop approached this in a deliberate manner, spending more than a year working with stakeholders... to identify the best way to invest in our research enterprise.

"This issue is so important that even our colleagues in the Senate have decided to address it. & while some legislative observers have noted that their approach to this has been less organized and focused, I appreciate that they recognize the urgency of the problem we are facing.
"There is no question: we must act now to redouble our commitment to American research and development if we are to remain the global leader in science and technology.
"They‚Äôre also out-spending us, plain and simple. China‚Äôs R&D spending increased by more than 50% between 2011 and 2016. In that same period, our investment fell by 12% in absolute terms.

"It‚Äôs no wonder then that we have seen the Chinese Communist Party pursue a technological advantage over us through forced acquisitions, malign foreign talent programs, and intellectual property theft.
"That‚Äôs because leading the world in science and technology gives you a significant advantage when it comes to national security, cybersecurity, and economic growth.
"Make no mistake ‚Äì this is a threat. For years, China has been working to steal ‚Äì both literally and figuratively ‚Äì our playbook for innovation.

"Before I discuss the specifics of the NSF for the Future Act, I want to emphasize why it is so critical we act now to counter the threat from Communist leadership in China and reinvest in American science and technology.
"Together, the NSF for the Future Act and the Department of Energy Science for the Future Act represent a comprehensive and sustainable approach to building American competitiveness.

"I rise in strong support of H.R. 2225, the National Science Foundation for the Future Act. This legislation is one of two Science Committee bills under consideration today to reinforce America‚Äôs global scientific leadership and fend off competition from the #CCP.

"... leading the world in science and technology gives you a significant advantage when it comes to national security, cybersecurity, and economic growth."
